NFTCollection.name: NFTCollection
NFTCollection.summary: Create a collection of one-of-one NFTs.
NFTCollection.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_nft_collection("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the token balance of a specific address

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens in the contract

methods.name: get_owned
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens owned by a specific address

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint a batch of new NFTs to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

        # You can customize this metadata however you like
        metadatas = [
            NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                "name": "Cool NFT",
                "description": "This is a cool NFT",
                "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
            }),
            NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                "name": "Cooler NFT",
                "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
                "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
            }),
        ]

        # You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
        txs = contract.mint_batch_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadatas)
        receipt = txs[0].receipt
        first_token_id = txs[0].id
        first_nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint a new NFT to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

        # Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
        metadata = NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
            "name": "Cool NFT",
            "description": "This is a cool NFT",
            "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
        })

        # You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
        tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata)
        receipt = tx.receipt
        token_id = tx.id
        nft = tx.data()

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.

Edition.name: Edition
Edition.summary: Create a collection of NFTs that lets you mint multiple copies of each NFT.
Edition.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_edition("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get a specific wallets balance of a specific token

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata for all tokens on the contract

methods.name: get_owned
methods.summary: Get the metadata for all the tokens owned by an address

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint a batch of NFTs to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

        # Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
        metadatas_with_supply = [
            EditionMetadataInput(
                NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                    "name": "Cool NFT",
                    "description": "This is a cool NFT",
                    "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
                }),
                100
            ),
            EditionMetadataInput(
                NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                    "name": "Cooler NFT",
                    "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
                    "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
                }),
                100
            )
        ]

        # You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
        txs = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata_with_supply)
        receipt = txs[0].receipt
        token_id = txs[0].id
        nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint a new NFT to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

        # Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
        metadata_with_supply = EditionMetadataInput(
            NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                "name": "Cool NFT",
                "description": "This is a cool NFT",
                "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
            }),
            100
        )

        # You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
        tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata_with_supply)
        receipt = tx.receipt
        token_id = tx.id
        nft = tx.data()

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.
methods.example:
to = "{{wallet_address}}"
        token_id = 0
        amount = 1

        receipt = contract.transfer(to, token_id, amount)

Token.name: Token
Token.summary: Create a standard crypto token or cryptocurrency.
Token.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_token("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: allowance
methods.summary: Get a specific spenders allowance of this token for the connected wallet.

methods.name: allowance_of
methods.summary: Get the allowance of the specified spender for a specified owner.
methods.example:
# Address of the wallet who owns the funds
        address = "{{wallet_address}}"

        # Address of the wallet to check the token allowance
        spender = "0x..."

        allowance = contract.allowance_of(address, spender)
        print(allowance)

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Get the token balance of the connected wallet.

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the balance of the specified wallet

methods.name: burn
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of tokens from the connected wallet.

methods.name: burn_from
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of tokens from a specified wallet.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the token metadata including name, symbol, decimals, etc.

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint tokens to a list of wallets.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.currency import TokenAmount

        args = [
            TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 1),
            TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 2),
        ]

        contract.mint_batch_to(args)

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint tokens to a specified wallet.

methods.name: set_allowance
methods.summary: Sets the allowance of the specified wallet over the connected wallets funds to        a specified amount.

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified amount of tokens from the connected wallet to a specified address.
methods.example:
# Address to send tokens to
        to = "0x...

        # Amount of tokens to transfer
        amount = 0.1

        contract.transfer(to, amount)

methods.name: transfer_batch
methods.summary: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.currency import TokenAmount

        data = [
            TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 0.1),
            TokenAmount("0x...", 0.2),
        ]

        contract.transfer_batch(data)

methods.name: transfer_from
methods.summary: Transfer a specified amount of tokens from one specified address to another.
methods.example:
# Address to send tokens from
        fr = "{{wallet_address}}"

        # Address to send tokens to
        to = "0x..."

        # Amount of tokens to transfer
        amount = 0.1

        contract.transfer_from(fr, to, amount)

Marketplace.name: Marketplace
Marketplace.summary: Create your own whitelabel marketplace that enables users to buy and sell any digital assets.
Marketplace.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_marketplace("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: buyout_listing
methods.summary: Buyout a listing by listing ID

methods.name: get_active_listings
methods.summary: Get all the currently active listings from the marketplace.

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get all the listings that have ever been made on this marketplace.

methods.name: get_all_listings
methods.summary: Get all the listings that have ever been made on this marketplace.

methods.name: set_bid_buffer_bps
methods.summary: Set the bid buffer basis points for this marketplace.

methods.name: set_time_buffer_in_seconds
methods.summary: Set the time buffer of the marketplace.

NFTDrop.name: NFTDrop
NFTDrop.summary: Setup a collection of one-of-one NFTs that are minted as users claim them.
NFTDrop.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_nft_drop("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the token balance of a specific address

methods.name: claim_to
methods.summary: Claim NFTs to a destination address.
methods.example:
address = {{wallet_address}}
        quantity = 1

        tx = contract.claim_to(address, quantity)
        receipt = tx.receipt
        claimed_token_id = tx.id
        claimed_nft = tx.data()

methods.name: create_batch
methods.summary: Create a batch of NFTs.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

        # You can customize this metadata however you like
        metadatas = [
            NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                "name": "Cool NFT",
                "description": "This is a cool NFT",
                "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
            }),
            NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
                "name": "Cooler NFT",
                "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
                "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
            }),
        ]

        txs = contract.create_batch(metadatas)
        first_token_id = txs[0].id
        first_nft = txs[0].data()

EditionDrop.name: EditionDrop
EditionDrop.summary: Setup a collection of NFTs with a customizable number of each NFT that are minted as users claim them.
EditionDrop.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK
    from eth_account import Account
    from web3 import Web3

    # You can switch out this provider and RPC URL for your own
    provider = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider("<RPC_URL>"))
    # This will create a random account to use for signing transactions
    signer = Account.create()

    sdk = ThirdwebSDK(provider, signer)
    contract = sdk.get_edition_drop("{{contract_address}}")
